about.title: About Us
about.name: The AhlulBayt Assembly of Kenya (ABAK)
about.description: ABAK is a faith-based non-profit organization committed to spreading the noble teachings of the Holy Qur'an, Prophet Muhammad (s.a.w.w), and the AhlulBayt (a.s). We strive to foster a spiritually aware and compassionate society through education, outreach, and empowerment.
about.mission: To invite all people to the true path as presented by the Qur'an and the teachings of the Final Messenger, Prophet Muhammad (s.a.w.w), and his purified progeny—the AhlulBayt (a.s).
about.vision: To nurture a united, just, and spiritually enriched Kenyan society grounded in the ethics and values of Islam.

chairman.title: Chairman – Sheikh Ali Saidi Samojah
chairman.name: Sheikh Ali Saidi Samojah
chairman.description: Sheikh Samojah is a leading scholar, community leader, and the Chairman of ABAK. His deep knowledge, outreach efforts, and unwavering commitment to the mission of AhlulBayt (a.s) teachings have inspired thousands across Kenya and beyond.

viceChairman.title: Vice Chairman – Sheikh Juma Shughuli
viceChairman.name: Sheikh Juma Shughuli
viceChairman.description: Sheikh Juma Shughuli serves as the Vice Chairman of ABAK, supporting programs that strengthen community education and faith-based initiatives.

treasurer.title: Treasurer – Sheikh Khamis Mwanjirani
treasurer.name: Sheikh Khamis Mwanjirani
treasurer.description: As Treasurer, Sheikh Mwanjirani ensures transparency and accountability in ABAK's financial stewardship and resource allocation.

secretary.title: Secretary – Brother Athman Farsiy
secretary.name: Brother Athman Farsiy
secretary.description: Brother Athman serves as the Secretary of ABAK, coordinating communication, documentation, and ensuring the smooth operation of all activities across the organization.

members.title: Board Members
members.description: ABAK’s board also includes representatives from various regions of Kenya, ensuring inclusive representation of different community centers and voices.

donate.title: Support Our Mission
donate.description: Your donation helps ABAK spread the teachings of Ahlul Bayt (a.s), uplift communities, and empower future generations through education, service, and faith.

events.stayUpdated: Stay updated with ABAK's impactful events across Kenya—spiritual, educational, and humanitarian.

programs.objectivesDescription: At the AhlulBayt Assembly of Kenya (ABAK), our mission is guided by a series of well-defined programs and objectives. These focus on spiritual guidance, community development, education, and empowerment. Each objective represents a step toward creating a more informed, unified, and compassionate society rooted in the teachings of the Ahlul Bayt (a.s).

hawza.title: Hawza Seminary
hawza.subtitle: Empowering the next generation of female Islamic scholars in Kenya.
hawza.about_subtitle: A Thriving Center for Islamic Learning
hawza.support_section_p: Help empower future female Islamic scholars. Sponsor a student with just 1,000 USD per year, covering accommodation and tuition.
hawza.section_subtitle: A Thriving Center for Islamic Learning
hawza.about_description: The Hawzah Seyyidah Zeinab (s.a) is an esteemed Islamic educational institution established by the Ahlulbayt Assembly of Kenya (ABAK). It provides a nurturing environment for young women to deepen their knowledge and understanding of the Islamic faith.
hawza.vision_desc: To develop a new generation of well-grounded, knowledgeable, and spiritually committed female Islamic scholars who will contribute meaningfully to the community and uphold the teachings of the Ahlulbayt (a.s).
hawza.mission_desc: To provide high-quality Islamic education rooted in the teachings of the Holy Qur’an and Ahlulbayt (a.s), empowering young women with knowledge, moral values, and leadership skills.
hawza.impact_desc: Since its inception, the Hawza has empowered dozens of young women, many of whom now actively serve in various religious, educational, and social capacities within their communities across Kenya.
